etymology.description: Pictogram (象形). Three distinct forms can be observed in ancient scripts, all of which have merged in modern script; unrelated to the right component of 往 (< 𢓸 ).
etymology.interpretation: Originally drawn forms varied but later standardized into the present graph, while the sense ‘master/primary’ became fixed. Do not confuse it with the right-side element of 往, which is etymologically unrelated.

examples.chinese: 他是这家店的主人(他是這家店的主人)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì zhè jiā diàn de zhǔrén.
examples.english: He is the owner of this shop.

examples.chinese: 这个计划的主要目标很明确(這個計劃的主要目標很明確)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège jìhuà de zhǔyào mùbiāo hěn míngquè.
examples.english: The primary goal of this plan is very clear.

examples.chinese: 他向主祈祷(他向主祈禱)。
